Our next war headline is 24 years later, January 30th 1968.
America was firmly entrenched in Vietnam.
The North had vowed to observe a truce in honor of the sacred Tet holiday.
But on that fateful day, North Vietnamese and Viet Cong troops began a massive assault on dozens of strategic locations throughout the country.
The move caught American and South Vietnamese forces off guard.

The January 30th edition of the New York Times picks up a very beginning of what would become the Tet Offensive with a surprisingly small headline, ""Viet Cong Attack Seven Cities, Allies Call Off Tet Truce."" Few knew how big the story would become in the following days.
